name: City Palace
description: A grand complex of courtyards, gardens, and museums overlooking Lake Pichola, showcasing royal Rajasthani architecture.

name: Jallianwala Bagh
description: A historic memorial garden marking the 1919 massacre, preserved as a symbol of sacrifice and India’s freedom struggle.

name: India Gate
description: A towering war memorial built to honor Indian soldiers of World War I, surrounded by lawns and evening lights.

name: Fort Kochi
description: A coastal heritage area known for its Chinese fishing nets, colonial buildings, art cafés, and vibrant cultural fusion.

name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
description: A 240-acre garden with rare plants, glasshouses, and serene walking trails — perfect for nature lovers.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: The “Palace of Winds,” a five-story pink sandstone structure with 953 windows built for royal women to observe street festivals.

name: Gateway of India
description: An iconic seafront monument built during the British Raj, facing the Arabian Sea and opposite the Taj Hotel.

name: Humayun's Tomb
description: A stunning Mughal-era tomb and UNESCO site, known for its Persian-style gardens and red sandstone architecture.

name: Sabarmati Ashram
description: Mahatma Gandhi’s residence and a peaceful riverside place showcasing his life, philosophy, and freedom movement.

name: Bangalore Palace
description: A Tudor-style palace inspired by England’s Windsor Castle, featuring ornate woodwork and royal artifacts.

name: Howrah Bridge
description: A massive cantilever bridge over the Hooghly River, known for its engineering marvel and bustling surroundings.

name: Golden Temple
description: The holiest Sikh shrine, famous for its golden façade, reflective water tank, and the world’s largest free kitchen.

name: Munnar Tea Gardens
description: Endless rolling hills covered with lush tea plantations, misty valleys, and scenic viewpoints.

name: Marine Drive
description: A 3.6 km sea-facing promenade nicknamed the “Queen’s Necklace,” stunning at sunset and great for night views.

name: Victoria Memorial
description: A beautiful white marble monument dedicated to Queen Victoria, surrounded by gardens and a museum.

name: Mehrangarh Fort
description: One of India’s largest forts, towering above the Blue City with palaces, courtyards, and panoramic desert views.

name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
description: A massive Dravidian-style temple with colorful gopurams, intricate sculptures, and deep religious significance.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
description: A UNESCO church housing the preserved remains of St. Francis Xavier, known for elegant Baroque architecture.

name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
description: Famous temples known for intricate erotic sculptures and stunning Nagara-style architecture.

name: Solang Valley
description: A popular adventure destination offering paragliding, skiing, ATV rides, and breathtaking mountain views.

name: Laxman Jhula
description: A famous suspension bridge over the Ganga River, offering scenic views and access to spiritual retreats.

name: Taj Mahal
description: A symbol of love, this white marble mausoleum is world-famous for its symmetry, carvings, and reflective pools.

name: Charminar
description: A historic 16th-century monument with four arches, bustling bazaars, and rich Islamic architecture.

name: Statue of Unity
description: The world’s tallest statue, dedicated to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, offering viewing galleries and laser shows.

name: Jagannath Temple
description: An ancient Hindu temple famous for the Rath Yatra festival and its deep spiritual significance.

name: Dal Lake
description: Known for houseboats, shikara rides, and floating markets amid the Himalayan landscape.

name: Mysore Palace
description: A grand Indo-Saracenic palace illuminated by 100,000+ lights every Sunday, known for its royal heritage.

name: Shaniwar Wada
description: A historic fortification of the Peshwas, remembered for its majestic gates and legendary stories.

name: Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga
description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, known for its sacred Bhasma Aarti and deep religious importance.

name: Kamakhya Temple
description: A unique Shakti Peeth temple atop Nilachal Hill, known for its mystical rituals and religious traditions.
